basic.floral_language:
Aloe dichotoma
Floriography: self-respect, tenacious, vital.
Aloe dichotoma is a compact evergreen succulent plant. Leaves thick and juicy, long lanceolate shaped with spines at edges. Besides ornamental cultivation, A. vera is popular for anti-bacteria, anti-inflammation, facial and mosquito off.
Aloe dichotoma requires sunbath for growth. It would go into short dormancy in winter and should stay warm. Yellow or orange flowers bloom in spring and summer.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, yellow or orange flowers

maintenance.soil: Peat mixed with coarse sand soil
maintenance.sunlight: Like sunshine, resistant to half shade, avoid strong direct light at noon in summer, excessive growth with less light
maintenance.watering: Need a lot of water when in peak growth stages during April to May, reduce water in summer and winter
maintenance.fertilization: Apply liquid fertilizers during April to May and September to November, except in summer and winter
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
